ratings.comment: Honors proseminar is easy credit.  Karen doesn't really know what she's doing though.  She's pretty unclear about what the undergrads should do, but for the upper level seniors it's a lot easier.  You just show up, listen to presentations, and eat pizza.  Required for honors students anyways.

No idea what you guys are talking about--i had her for my zoo101 class for fall'08 and her lectures are clear and just at the right pace. don't blame the professor if you were too lazy to look over slides before you came to lecture.

I had her as one of my three profs for zoo 101. She's a decent professor. Lectures can be a bit hard to follow at times. She comes off as a bit spacey, but knows the material. She's very approachable and will answer questions.
She was very unclear in all of her lectures and her test questions were very confusing.

Karen's lectures are always very useful.  Many people have a problem with how fast she is going, but as long as you print out the slides you will do fine.  She lectures on things that interest her and that she has had first hand experience with (camels!).  Tests on some obscure things though... such as pre-historic dates.  Know the dates!
Fun teacher but very hard exams

She went through the material quickly, but it's mostly review if you took high school biology. Her test questions weren't terrificly written. In office she was nice and moderately helpful. She loves Zoology, and while she's not the best lecturer, she's manageable.

Her lecture style was okay but she can be a bit confusing. However if you look over the slides and go to a discussion class it is pretty easy to grasp the info. She lays everything out in her slides that you need to know which might or might not be a good thing. For me it was bad because I wasn't forced to pay attention.

Professor Steudel can be confusing during her lectures, but if you go to her office hours, or just stop by whenever, she's very helpful and a very nice person. It is not hard to understand her material, but you shouldn't buy the book. I never opened it and I got an A. Visit the professors outside of class though, even if it's just once
Not a good professor. She flies through the material WAY too fast and her test questions are harder than they should be for what she's actually taught us. Do Not Take Zoo 101
She writes the worst, most uncomprehendable test questions of any professor i've ever had. She goes through the slides way too fast, so you are screwed if you forget to print them off before class
Very difficult to pay attention to. Runs through material at a fast pace. Not very helpful to talk to.

by far worst professor of trilogy.  goes too fast, slides are useless.  doesn't actually teach, just throws out information to memorize for the test.  i'll probably forget everything she taught midway through christmas break.
Very straightforward everything is on powerpoint notes

She was a very good prof.  Her lectures were very well organized and as long as you print the slides you are fine.  Some of the test questions could be confusing.  She was funny and intelligent, and she always had cute shoes ;)

If you print off slides before going to lecture, you've got nearly all of the material she will cover in lecture. It's very easy to study for her tests because it's all on the slides. Sometimes hard to get ahold of with questions, because she didn't hold review sessions like Thoma did.

tends to rush things, but still is very understandable. tends to waste powerpoint slides on pictures and stupid stuff more than thoma, but i think the slides are still helpful to have, overall a pretty good prof
She goes waaay too fast. If you don't have the slides it's practically impossible to write everything down.
She is actually quite the character, very down to earth.  She makes funny jokes/statments.  She sometimes gets tripped up in her speech but it always is explained clearly thereafter.
No Comments

this class is NOT HARD unless you're STUPID. She & Sharon Thoma recommend printing out lecture notes.. DON'T. You learn better if you write things down, you use probably 10x less paper and save ink. It's bad enough that teachers rely on powerpoints, you shouldn't as well.
The best teacher for this course!  She is available for answering things that are unclear, and if you understand the notes from lecture you'll do fine on her tests.  I recommend her!

The best of the 3 profs that teach this class.  She is funny, tries to make class interesting.  Presents material at level that students can understand.  Tests are very difficult, but there is a curve. Go to optional discussion sections and use the CD that comes with the book.
stupid class, but not her fault, she makes dumb jokes but at least she tries!  clearer than the other 2 profs that teach the class  dont take this class unless you need it

She tries to make the class fun. The tests were multiple choice, and you really had to think about the different choices. Notes are online. You could skip the lecture, but then you should read the book. I went to lecture, and never read the book.
This professor is great.  She'll tell jokes when she's losing people, and has a good feel for the students.  Definitely the best of the three professors that teach this class.
A very hard course. All the lecture notes on site. Can miss classes. Especially the last 4 weeks of class. Boring. Hard tests!
I got the test and wanted to take it back and ask the TA for the real test becuase it had to be a joke. It was that hard.
She's a very funny lady- she tells jokes in class. She does a good job at keeping her lectures interesting, but the tests are very very difficult!
She was the best of the three teachers.  She's pretty funny in a ditzy way.
Tests are crazy hard.
Was not a real big fan of the subject matter, she didnt present the information as very difficult but the tests werent easy by any means, still a pretty good professor overall
This is an alright class. She is the best of the three teachers. Great enthusiasm. Tries hard to make boring material interesting.
She presents the material as if it is easy, but the tests are very difficult.
